definition: reflect a thousand times and you can still make a mistake (idiom); to err is human
see 鞦韆|秋千[qiu1 qian1]
thousand
to think over/to consider/anxiety
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to lose/to miss/to fail
a thousand tries leads to one success (idiom, humble expr.); Even without any notable ability on my part, I may still get it right sometimes by good luck.
lit. a wise person reflecting a thousand times can still make a mistake (idiom); fig. nobody is infallible
pinyin: zhi4 zhe3 qian1 lu:4 , bi4 you3 yi1 shi1

definition: lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
perfectly sound proposition/unalterable truth/irrefutable argument
cow and famous steed at the same trough (idiom); fig. the common and the great are treated alike
lit. light as a goose feather, heavy as Mt Tai (idiom)/fig. of no consequence to one person, a matter of life or death to another
with money, you can do anything (idiom)/money talks
no danger of anything going wrong/no risk at all
to judge people based on their success or failure (idiom)
to invert the importance of things (i.e. stress the unimportant and neglect the important)/lacking a sense of perspective/to put the cart before the horse
indisputable statement/unalterable truth
clay ox, wooden horse (idiom); shape without substance/worthless object
(following a noun) full of .../abounding in ...
lit. to catch sparrows blindfolded (idiom)/fig. to act blindly
pinyin: bi4 se4 yan3 jing1 zhuo1 ma2 que4

definition: to be ridiculous/to make a fool of oneself
improvisation/flexible/adaptable/pragmatic
